data.title: Ars Technica
data.meta_description: Serving the Technologist for more than a decade. IT news, reviews, and analysis.
data.text:
Crytek, Cloud Imperium battle over how to end Star Citizen lawsuit

Back in late 2017, we told you about Crytek's lawsuit against Star Citizen developer Cloud Imperium Games over an "exclusive" license to use CryEngine in its titles. Now, over two years (and one failed settlement attempt) later, the two companies...

Star Citizen maker says engine suit “never should have been filed”

Star Citizen developer Cloud Imperium Games (CIG) has offered a strongly worded response to a lawsuit brought last month by CryEngine maker Crytek, saying that suit "never should have been filed" and that its "contrived claims... sacrifice legal...

Crytek sues Star Citizen developers over game engine

Star Citizen's lengthy and heavily crowd-funded development has been marked by numerous changes to the project's direction and scope, including a move from Crytek's CryEngine to Amazon's Lumberyard in late 2016. That change is now the focus of a...

CryEngine 3 now fully supports Linux and OpenGL

CryEngine, the game engine developed by Crytek that is used by a number of large games including Crysis, Homefront: The Revolution, Ryse, and Star Citizen, now officially supports Linux. As a rather pleasing side effect of Linux support, CryEngine...

Ryse developer Crytek “not 100 percent happy with Xbox One sales”

Occasionally, people ask me why Ars sometimes covers the relative sales performance of various consoles. "Who cares which console is 'winning'?" the argument goes. "I just want to play games." And my response is generally that relative sales...

Report: Crytek UK staff not getting paid, leave studio en masse

Video game and 3D engine developer Crytek, responsible for the original Far Cry game and the Crysis and Ryse series, became attached to a wave of rumors about unpaid workers last week. Kotaku's original report pointed to late paychecks at its...

THQ split up and sold in five parts through bankruptcy auction

The writing was on the wall when THQ filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection last month, and now that writing has been etched in stone. After a 22-hour auction, the major publisher's component parts have been divided and sold off in five separate...

Crytek CEO quietly confident after Unreal Engine 4 reveal

Crytek CEO and founder Cevat Yerli has a lot to be proud of. In just over a decade, his company has gone from a personal hobby to a major player in the game industry. Not only have its first-person franchises like Far Cry and Crysis become synonymous...

The fall of New York: Ars reviews Crysis 2

"This is what it must have looked like," I thought to myself as I stood in a virtual New York street. I watched a building get hit by a crashing alien craft before it crumbled to the ground. There are multiple scenes of such destruction in Crysis 2,...

First look: Crysis 2 comes to consoles, destroys NYC

The original Crysis, despite being three years old, is still one of the best looking PC games. Having a system that ran the game well was a badge of pride when the game launched. The game's allure was enough to merit shelling out major green for...

Crysis 2 confirmed for PS3, 360, and PC

It has been clear for some time that Crytek is getting into the console game in a big way, but now more details are official: Crysis 2 is coming to the PS3 and Xbox 360 as well as the PC. This isn't the most shocking news out there, but it's...

CryEngine 3 coming to PS3, 360

If there's one thing we've learned about Crytek, it's that the developer makes some damn impressive game engines. While games like Far Cry and Crysis are truly gorgeous to look at, the latest version of CryEngine is even capable of some truly...

Artists recreate classic movie scenes with Crytek engine

The "games as art" debate has had the scales tipped even more in the favor of those who argue that games qualify as a means for artistic expression. A competition through the Game Artist forums has resulted in some stunning recreations of scenes...

Crytek to show off newest engine at GDC, for PC and consoles

Crytek used to look like the last great hope for hardcore PC gamers; a company that is dedicated to showing off what the latest and greatest PC hardware can do. Crytek knows which side of the bread their butter is on, however, and it has just...

Modders, start your engines: Crysis Warhead SDK coming

There's a running joke around the office that we've never reviewed or even really talked much about Crysis or Crysis Warhead. While that may be true, we certainly have spent our fair share of time with Crytek's lush first-person...
